application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions:
TREE WORKS (COMPLIANCE):  All tree work shall be carried out in accordance with British Standard BS3998 - Recommendations for Tree Work.  In addition: 
a)   No fires shall be lit within [10] metres of the nearest point of the canopy of any retained tree.  No equipment, machinery or structure shall be attached to or supported by a retained tree.
b)   No mixing of cement or use of other contaminating materials or substances shall take place within, or close enough to, a root protection area that seepage or displacement could cause them to enter a root protection area. 
c)   No alterations or variations to the approved works or tree protection schemes shall be made without prior written consent of the local planning authority.

REASON:  In the interest of the protection of trees and to safeguard visual amenities.
description:
Tree location - rear garden
Access  side access

T1 - Approx. H18+ S10+ 70+DBH Conifer
Crown reduce height by 2m
Cut back laterals on western side by 2-2.5m to clear building.
Deadwood
Lift 6m
Sever and shave off Ivy

T2 - Approx. H7 S4 26DBH Thorn
Fell as close as possible to ground level 


T3 - Approx. H3 S3 15DBH group of Elder
Fell as close as possible to ground level


T4 - Approx. H4 S4 15DBH group of Elder
Fell as close as possible to ground level


T5 - Approx. H2 S1 10DBH self set Ash
Fell as close as possible 

Tree work is to be undertaken to remove dead branches to improve form and increase safety in accordance with good arboriculture practice and maintain the future wellbeing and growth of the trees.
